verses.kjv: Then Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?
verses.ct: "How much longer will you torment my soul and crush me with your words?

verses.kjv: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
verses.ct: You've insulted me 10 times now. Aren't you ashamed of how harshly you treat me?

verses.kjv: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
verses.ct: Even if I really have made mistakes, those mistakes are my own burden to carry.

verses.kjv: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:
verses.ct: If you insist on elevating yourselves above me and using my disgrace as evidence against me,

verses.kjv: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.
verses.ct: then understand this: it is God who has brought me down. He has trapped me in his net.

verses.kjv: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
verses.ct: I cry out about the injustice, but no one answers. I shout for help, but there is no justice.

verses.kjv: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
verses.ct: He has blocked my path so I can't get through, and he has covered my road with darkness.

verses.kjv: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.
verses.ct: He has stripped away my honor and removed the crown from my head.

verses.kjv: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
verses.ct: He has torn me apart from every direction until I'm finished. He has uprooted my hope like a tree.

verses.kjv: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
verses.ct: His anger burns hot against me, and he considers me one of his enemies.

verses.kjv: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
verses.ct: His forces advance together; they build their siege ramp against me and surround my home on all sides.

verses.kjv: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.
verses.ct: He has driven my brothers far away from me, and everyone I know has become a complete stranger to me.

verses.kjv: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
verses.ct: My relatives have abandoned me, and my closest friends have forgotten I exist.

verses.kjv: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.
verses.ct: The people living in my household and my servant women treat me like an outsider. I've become a foreigner to them.

verses.kjv: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.
verses.ct: I call for my servant, but he doesn't respond, even when I personally beg him.

verses.kjv: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children’s sake of mine own body.
verses.ct: My breath disgusts my wife, and I am repulsive to my own brothers and sisters.

verses.kjv: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.
verses.ct: Even little children look down on me; when I stand up, they mock me.

verses.kjv: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.
verses.ct: All my closest friends are horrified by me, and the people I loved have turned against me.

verses.kjv: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
verses.ct: I'm nothing but skin and bones, and I've barely escaped with my life.

verses.kjv: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.
verses.ct: Have mercy on me! Have mercy on me, my friends! The hand of God has struck me.

verses.kjv: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.ct: Why do you pursue me the way God does? Haven't you had enough of tearing into me?

verses.kjv: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!
verses.ct: If only my words could be written down! If only they could be recorded in a book!

verses.kjv: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
verses.ct: If only they were carved into rock with an iron chisel and filled with lead forever!

verses.kjv: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:
verses.ct: I know that my redeemer is alive, and that in the end he will stand upon the earth.

verses.kjv: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:
verses.ct: Even after my skin has been destroyed, in my flesh I will see God.

verses.kjv: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.
verses.ct: I will see him myself — my own eyes will look at him, not someone else's. My heart aches with longing inside me.

verses.kjv: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?
verses.ct: You should be asking yourselves, 'Why are we persecuting him?' since the real problem lies with you.

verses.kjv: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
verses.ct: You should be terrified of the sword, because anger brings the punishment of the sword, and then you will know that there is a judgment."
